text: SLOC may refer to: * Salt Lake Organizing Committee, the organization responsible for the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City, Utah * Schenectady Light Opera Company, a nonprofit community theater organization in Schenectady, New York * Secured line of credit, a type of credit source extended to a government, business or individual by a bank or other financial institution * security link over coax, one type of ethernet over coax * Sea lines of communication, the primary maritime routes between ports, used for trade, logistics and naval forces * Source lines of code, a software metric used to measure the size of a software program
title: SLOC
